result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas W Bickert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Straight Time . Sentence credit of 21 days was granted if imposed.
Consecutive to:
Probation may be transferred to Jefferson County.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to Restitution for Aurara Hospital, paid in full.
Cash bail applied to costs, balance to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered. Sign releases for agent

Inform agent of all prescriptions. Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours. Release for standard conditions. STAYED for use at agent's discretion.

supervisions.notes:
Straight Time if imposed.
Consecutive to:

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas W Bickert

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC
  Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter received and filed.

Defendant Thomas W Bickert in court with Attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing.  State gives recommendation.  Attorney Weathers makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:   IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

3 MONTHS JAIL STRAIGHT TIME  (CREDIT - 21 days)  **CONSECUTIVE ** 

TERM OF PROBATION:  18 MONTHS      **TRANSFER ALLOWED TO JEFFERSON COUNTY**

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;

RESTITUTION:  $1.19 to Aurora Hospital (to be paid as a condition of probation - restitution to be paid before costs or fines)

COSTS:  $253.00 (to be paid out of cash bail posted ($200.00) and remainder due as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME:   30 Days,  Non-working hours with standard release conditions - STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion


COUNT #2:   IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

3 MONTHS JAIL STRAIGHT TIME    **CONSECUTIVE ** 

TERM OF PROBATION:  18 MONTHS      **TRANSFER ALLOWED TO JEFFERSON COUNTY**

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;

COSTS:  $243.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation)
Sentencing hearing at 10-05-2015 11:00 am
Dated today, from Atty Weathers to Judge Carter, requesting adjournment of 10/23/15 hearing.
Based upon letter dated 09/14/15 from WCS, requirement for WCS monitoring through Jefferson County is rescinded.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
Dated 09/10/15, from Atty Weathers to Judge Carter, requesting adjournment of 10/23/15 hearing.
Sentencing hearing at 10-23-2015 11:00 am

Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness/business unless its for emergency.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant to comply with WCS monitoring through Jefferson County (Defendant to report initially to Waukesha County WCS).  Defendant allowed phone calls to raise bail money.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Thomas W Bickert in court with Attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court quashes warrant.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts #1 & 2.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Counts #1 & 2.   Repeater enhancers are stricken on both counts.  Attorney Weathers requests sentencing date.  Court addresses WCS letter filed today.  State makes statements regarding WCS letter.  Attorney Weathers makes statements.  Court modifies bail - setting cash bail at $200.00.
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter received and filed.
Signed by Judge Ramirez for Judge Carter on 08/13/15.
Non compliance with WCS. Br. 4 only.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.

Attorney Weathers states that Defendant is having transportation issues for testing and is trying to find places he can test at.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
